work.name: Wells Fargo
work.summary: Software Engineer in Finance Technology (Corporate Treasury - Valuation & Product Control) Line of Business
highlights: Led the development and maintenance of the IPV Application in India time, supporting accurate pricing and valuation of financial portfolios worth $200B+, using Angular, Django, Python(for ETL), Autosys for cron job scheduling, and Liquibase for database change management.
Designed and implemented a Python-based ETL pipeline processing 30M+ records daily from 130+ sources (databases, APIs, FTP servers, file reads).
Developed and scheduled 50+ daily/monthly ETL jobs using Autosys, streamlining ingestion and processing into the IPV Tool.
Automated generation and validation of 50+ commodity control sheets using Python, eliminating 250,000+ formula operations, saving 8 hours of effort and reducing processing time by 99.6%.
Recognized with the Team Spotlight Award for reducing 75+ yearly incidents caused by postâ€“US holiday job failures, improving system reliability by 46%;
Translated business needs into production-ready features, defining functional and non-functional requirements and integrating them into the application using Agile and CI/CD practices.

work.name: Multimodal Digital Media Analysis (MIDAS) Lab, IIIT Delhi
highlights: Evaluated the reasoning capabilities of 5 Multimodal Large Language Models in the geometry domain.
Led a team of 3 to create GEOVQA, a high-quality Indian-context geometry benchmark dataset with 4K images.

Devised the Mixture of Refinement Agents (MoRA) framework to iteratively reduce reasoning errors in physics tasks, improving accuracy by up to 16% on SciEval and MMLU for open-source LLMs(LLaMA-3 and Gemma-2).

work.name: Citi
work.summary: Summer Intern in Treasury and Trade Solutions (TTS) Business Unit
highlights: Proposed and migrated the UI of an in-house Process Automation Tool from Thymeleaf to Angular, used for productivity tracking and vendor resource management in the Payments and Receivables unit.

work.name: ISRO COEP Satellite Team Initiative (CSAT)
work.position: Attitude Determination and Control Subsystem(ADCS) Contributor
highlights: Implemented the TRIAD algorithm and an Unscented Kalman Filter in C to determine satellite attitude and improve the accuracy of attitude estimation, respectively, with testing performed using real satellite data.

awards.title: Best Performer of Mathematics at UG Level
awards.summary: Prize instituted by Dr. V. L. Deshpande and Mrs. Usha Deshpande. Awarded for scoring a perfect grade (10/10) in all Mathematics courses (Linear Algebra, Univariate Calculus, Ordinary Differential Equations, Multivariate Calculus, Vector Calculus and Partial Differential Equations, Probability and Statistics for Engineers) at undergraduate level.

awards.title: Certificate of Merit (Third Year Topper)

awards.title: Frank Hirschvogel Excellence Award
awards.summary: Award presented for the 1st Rank in Institute and Computer Engineering Department in T.Y.B.Tech with CGPA of 9.81/10.

awards.title: Certificate of Merit (Second Year Topper)
awards.summary: Awarded for the 1st Rank in S.Y.B.Tech (Computer Engineering) with a CGPA of 9.89/10.

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
